lead_paragraph: MARK--Erika Reider, of New York City and East Hampton died on January 5, 2016 after a brief illness. She was predeceased by her husband Richard, to whom she was lovingly married for 57 years. She is survived by her daughters, Jennifer and Audrey, and grandchildren Emily, Johnny, Henry, Tommy and Charlie, as well as her brothers, Alan and Jeffrey Reider. She graduated from Wellesley College and had a stellar career as a magazine editor. She received the National Magazine Award for her work at Good Housekeeping and was honored at a reception with President Clinton at the White House. She was fluent in five languages and was an avid world traveler with an adventurous spirit. She enjoyed playing tennis at the East Hampton Tennis Club and golf at the Noyac Golf Club as well as participating in two book clubs. Most of all she loved spending time with her family who greatly adored her and will miss her terribly. Funeral services to be held Friday January 8, 2016 at 2:00pm at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. 1/3
